page.title: 19Rhines
page.content: The area around Middlezoy like much of Sedgemoor is criss-crossed with man-made drainage ditches known locally as rhines. Many rare plants grow in and around the rhines, but these have to be cleared from time to time to prevent the ditches from becoming blocked. This did not matter when the ditches were cleared by hand because most plants were able to survive. However, conservationists are worried that with the advent of mechanised clearing, larger areas can be cleared more quickly and the plants have less chance of survival. The use of herbicides and pesticides also pose a threat to the wildlife. As the drainage improves more land is suitable for ploughing. This makes for more efficient farming, but means that the area will lose its distinctive character.
